00010 sub random_inv_matrix { ## Builds and returns a random invertible \$row by \$col matrix.
00011 
00012     warn "Usage: \$new_matrix = random_inv_matrix(\$rows,\$cols)"
00013       if (@_ != 2);
00014     my $A = new Matrix($_[0],$_[1]);
00015     my $A_lr = new Matrix($_[0],$_[1]);
00016     my $det = 0;
00017     my $safety=0;
00018     while ($det == 0 and $safety < 6) {
00019         foreach my $i (1..$_[0]) {
00020             foreach my $j (1..$_[1]) {
00021                 $A->assign($i,$j,random(-9,9,1) );
00022                 }
00023             }
00024             $A_lr = $A->decompose_LR();
00025             $det = $A_lr->det_LR();
00026         }
00027     return $A;
00028 }

00030 =head4 random_diag_matrix
00031 
00032 This method returns a random nxn diagonal matrix.
00033 
00034 =cut
00035 
00036 sub random_diag_matrix{ ## Builds and returns a random diagonal \$n by \$n matrix
00037     
00038     warn "Usage: \$new_matrix = random_diag_matrix(\$n)" if (@_ != 1);
00039     
00040     my $D = new Matrix($_[0],$_[0]);
00041     my $norm = 0;
00042     while( $norm == 0 ){
00043         foreach my $i (1..$_[0]){
00044             foreach my $j (1..$_[0]){
00045                 if( $i != $j ){
00046                     $D->assign($i,$j,0);
00047                 }else{
00048                     $D->assign($i,$j,random(-9,9,1));
00049                 }           
00050             }       
00051         }
00052         $norm = abs($D);
00053     }
00054     return $D;
00055 }
00056 
00057 sub swap_rows{
00058 
00059     warn "Usage: \$new_matrix = swap_rows(\$matrix,\$row1,\$row2);"
00060       if (@_ != 3);
00061     my $matrix = $_[0];
00062     my ($i,$j) = ($_[1],$_[2]);
00063     warn "Error:  Rows to be swapped must exist!" 
00064       if ($i>@$matrix or $j >@$matrix);
00065     warn "Warning:  Swapping the same row is pointless"
00066       if ($i==$j);    
00067     my $cols = @{$matrix->[0]};
00068     my $B = new Matrix(@$matrix,$cols);
00069     foreach my $k (1..$cols){
00070         $B->assign($i,$k,element $matrix($j,$k));
00071         $B->assign($j,$k,element $matrix($i,$k));
00072     }
00073     return $B;
00074 }
00075 
00076 sub row_mult{
00077 
00078     warn "Usage: \$new_matrix = row_mult(\$matrix,\$scalar,\$row);"
00079       if (@_ != 3);
00080     my $matrix = $_[0];
00081     my ($scalar,$row) = ($_[1],$_[2]);
00082     warn "Undefined row multiplication" 
00083       if ($row > @$matrix);
00084     my $B = new Matrix(@$matrix,@{$matrix->[0]});
00085     foreach my $j (1..@{$matrix->[0]}) {
00086         $B->assign($row,$j,$scalar*element $matrix($row,$j));
00087     }
00088     return $B;
00089 }
00090 
00091 sub linear_combo{
00092 
00093     warn "Usage: \$new_matrix = linear_combo(\$matrix,\$scalar,\$row1,\$row2);"
00094       if (@_ != 4);
00095     my $matrix = $_[0];
00096     my ($scalar,$row1,$row2) = ($_[1],$_[2],$_[3]);
00097     warn "Undefined row in multiplication"
00098       if ($row1>@$matrix or $row2>@$matrix);
00099     warn "Warning:  Using the same row"
00100       if ($row1==$row2);
00101     my $B = new Matrix(@$matrix,@{$matrix->[0]});
00102     foreach my $j (1..@$matrix) {
00103         my ($t1,$t2) = (element $matrix($row1,$j),element $matrix($row2,$j));
00104         $B->assign($row2,$j,$scalar*$t1+$t2);
00105     }
00106     return $B;
00107 }
00108 
00109 =head3 basis_cmp()
00110 
00111 Compares a list of vectors by finding the change of coordinate matrix
00112 from the Prof's vectors to the students, and then taking the determinant of
00113 that to determine the existence of the change of coordinate matrix going the
00114 other way.
00115 
00116 ANS( basis_cmp( vectors_as_array_ref_in_array_ref, options_hash ) );
00117 
00118     1. a reference to an array of correct vectors
00119     2. a hash with the following keys (all optional):
00120         mode            --  'basis' (default) (only a basis allowed)
00121                             'orthogonal' (only an orthogonal basis is allowed)
00122                             'unit' (only unit vectors in the basis allowed)
00123                             'orthonormal' (only orthogonal unit vectors in basis allowed)
00124         zeroLevelTol    --  absolute tolerance to allow when answer is close
00125                                  to zero
00126 
00127         debug           --  if set to 1, provides verbose listing of
00128                                 hash entries throughout fliters.
00129 
00130         help        --  'none' (default) (is quiet on all errors)
00131                     'dim' (Tells student if wrong number of vectors are entered)
00132                     'length' (Tells student if there is a vector of the wrong length)
00133                     'orthogonal' (Tells student if their vectors are not orthogonal)
00134                             (This is only in orthogonal mode)
00135                     'unit' (Tells student if there is a vector not of unit length)
00136                             (This is only in unit mode)
00137                     'orthonormal' (Gives errors from orthogonal and orthonormal)
00138                             (This is only in orthonormal mode)
00139                     'verbose' (Gives all the above answer messages)             
00140 
00141     Returns an answer evaluator.
00142 
00143 EXAMPLES:
00144 
00145     basis_cmp([[1,0,0],[0,1,0],[0,0,1]])
00146                                     --  correct answer is any basis for R^3.
00147     basis_cmp([1,0,2,0],[0,1,0,0], 'mode'=>orthonormal )
00148                                     --  correct answer is any orthonormal basis
00149                                         for this space such as:
00150                                         [1/sqrt(3),0,2/sqrt(3),0],[0,1,0,0]
00151 
00152 =cut
00153 
00154 
00155 sub basis_cmp {
00156     my $correctAnswer = shift;
00157     my %opt = @_;
00158 
00159     set_default_options(    \%opt,
00160             'zeroLevelTol'          =>  $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault,
00161             'debug'                 =>  0,
00162             'mode'                  =>  'basis',
00163             'help'                  =>  'none',
00164     );
00165     
00166     # produce answer evaluator
00167     BASIS_CMP(
00168             'correct_ans'       =>  $correctAnswer,
00169             'zeroLevelTol'      =>  $opt{'zeroLevelTol'},
00170             'debug'             =>  $opt{'debug'},
00171             'mode'              =>  $opt{'mode'},
00172             'help'              =>  $opt{'help'},               
00173     );
00174 }

00178 Made to keep the same format as num_cmp and fun_cmp.

00182 sub BASIS_CMP {
00183     my %mat_params = @_;
00184     my $zeroLevelTol                =   $mat_params{'zeroLevelTol'};
00185     
00186     # Check that everything is defined:
00187     $mat_params{debug} = 0 unless defined($mat_params{debug});
00188     $zeroLevelTol = $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault         unless defined $zeroLevelTol;
00189     $mat_params{'zeroLevelTol'}             =   $zeroLevelTol;
00190 
00191 ## This is where the correct answer should be checked someday.
00192     my $matrix                  =   Matrix->new_from_col_vecs($mat_params{'correct_ans'});
00193 
00194 #construct the answer evaluator
00195     my $answer_evaluator = new AnswerEvaluator;
00196 
00197     $answer_evaluator->{debug} = $mat_params{debug};
00198     $answer_evaluator->ans_hash(    
00199         correct_ans         =>  display_correct_vecs($mat_params{correct_ans}),
00200         rm_correct_ans      =>  $matrix,
00201         zeroLevelTol        =>  $mat_params{zeroLevelTol},
00202         debug               =>  $mat_params{debug},
00203         mode                =>  $mat_params{mode},
00204         help                =>  $mat_params{help},
00205     );
00206 
00207     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(
00208         sub {my $rh_ans              = shift;
00209             $rh_ans->{_filter_name}  = 'remove_white_space';
00210             $rh_ans->{student_ans}   =~ s/\s+//g;       # remove all whitespace
00211             $rh_ans;
00212         }
00213     );
00214     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(
00215         sub{my $rh_ans      = shift; 
00216             my @options     = @_;
00217             $rh_ans->{_filter_name}  = 'mung_student_answer';
00218             if( $rh_ans->{ans_label} =~ /$ArRaY/ ){
00219                 $rh_ans           = ans_array_filter($rh_ans,@options);     
00220                 my @student_array = @{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}};
00221                 my @array         = ();
00222                 for( my $i = 0; $i < scalar(@student_array) ; $i ++ )
00223                 {
00224                     push( @array, Matrix->new_from_array_ref($student_array[$i]));
00225                 }
00226                 $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} = \@array;
00227                 $rh_ans;
00228             }else{
00229                 $rh_ans->{student_ans}    = math_constants($rh_ans->{student_ans});
00230                 vec_list_string($rh_ans, '_filter_name' => 'vec_list_string', @options);
00231             }
00232         }
00233     );#ra_student_ans is now the students answer as an array of vectors
00234     # anonymous subroutine to check dimension and length of the student vectors
00235     # if either is wrong, the answer is wrong.
00236     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(
00237         sub{
00238             my $rh_ans               = shift;
00239             $rh_ans->{_filter_name}  = 'check_vector_size';
00240             my $length               = $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans}->[1];
00241             my $dim                  = $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans}->[2];
00242             if( $dim != scalar(@{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}}))
00243             {
00244             
00245                 $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00246                 if( $rh_ans->{help} =~ /dim|verbose/ )
00247                 {
00248                     $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','You have entered the wrong number of vectors.');
00249                 }else{
00250                     $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00251                 }
00252             }
00253             for( my $i = 0; $i < scalar( @{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} }) ; $i++ )
00254             {
00255                 if( $length != $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}->[$i]->[1])
00256                 {
00257                     $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00258                     if( $rh_ans->{help} =~ /length|verbose/ )
00259                     {
00260                         $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','You have entered vector(s) of the wrong length.');
00261                     }else{
00262                         $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00263                     }
00264                 }
00265             }
00266             $rh_ans;
00267         }
00268     );
00269     # Install prefilter for various modes
00270     if( $mat_params{mode} ne 'basis' )
00271     {
00272         if( $mat_params{mode} =~ /orthogonal|orthonormal/ )
00273         {
00274             $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(\&are_orthogonal_vecs);
00275         }
00276         
00277         if( $mat_params{mode} =~ /unit|orthonormal/ )
00278         {
00279             $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(\&are_unit_vecs);
00280                     
00281         }
00282     }
00283         $answer_evaluator->install_evaluator(\&compare_basis, %mat_params);
00284     $answer_evaluator->install_post_filter(
00285         sub {my $rh_ans = shift;
00286                 if ($rh_ans->catch_error('SYNTAX') ) {
00287                     $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $rh_ans->{error_message};
00288                     $rh_ans->clear_error('SYNTAX');
00289                 }
00290                 if ($rh_ans->catch_error('EVAL') ) {
00291                     $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $rh_ans->{error_message};
00292                     $rh_ans->clear_error('EVAL');
00293                 }
00294                 $rh_ans;
00295         }
00296     );
00297     $answer_evaluator;
00298 }

00300 =head4 compare_basis
00301 
00302     compare_basis( $ans_hash, 
00303         %options
00304         ra_student_ans     # a reference to the array of students answer vectors
00305         rm_correct_ans,    # a reference to the correct answer matrix

00314 sub compare_basis {
00315     my ($rh_ans, %options) = @_;
00316     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = "compare_basis";
00317     my @ch_coord;
00318     my @vecs = @{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}};
00319     
00320     # A lot of the following code was taken from Matrix::proj_coeff
00321     # calling this method recursively would be a waste of time since
00322     # the prof's matrix never changes and solve_LR is an expensive
00323     # operation. This way it is only done once.
00324     my $matrix = $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans};
00325     my ($dim,$x_vector, $base_matrix);
00326     my $errors = undef;
00327     my $lin_space_tr= ~ $matrix; #transpose of the matrix
00328     $matrix = $lin_space_tr * $matrix;  #(~A * A)
00329     my $matrix_lr = $matrix->decompose_LR();
00330     
00331     #finds the coefficient vectors for each of the students vectors
00332     for( my $i = 0; $i < scalar(@{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}}) ; $i++ ) {
00333     
00334         $vecs[$i] = $lin_space_tr*$vecs[$i];
00335         ($dim,$x_vector, $base_matrix) = $matrix_lr->solve_LR($vecs[$i]);
00336         push( @ch_coord, $x_vector );
00337         $errors = "A unique adapted answer could not be determined.  
00338         Possibly the parameters have coefficient zero.<br>  dim = $dim base_matrix 
00339         is $base_matrix\n" if $dim;  # only print if the dim is not zero.
00340     }
00341     
00342     if( defined($errors)) {
00343         $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL', $errors) ;
00344     } else {
00345         my $ch_coord_mat = Matrix->new_from_col_vecs(\@ch_coord);
00346             #creates change of coordinate matrix
00347             #existence of this matrix implies that
00348             #the all of the students answers are a
00349             #linear combo of the prof's
00350         $ch_coord_mat = $ch_coord_mat->decompose_LR();
00351         
00352         if( abs($ch_coord_mat->det_LR()) > $options{zeroLevelTol} ) {
00353             # if the det of the change of coordinate  matrix is
00354             # non-zero, this implies the existence of an inverse
00355             # which implies all of the prof's vectors are a linear
00356             # combo of the students vectors, showing containment
00357             # both ways.
00358 
00359             # I think sometimes if the students space has the same dimension as the profs space it
00360             # will get projected into the profs space even if it isn't a basis for that space.
00361             # this just checks that the prof's matrix times the change of coordinate matrix is actually
00362             #the students matrix
00363             if(  abs(Matrix->new_from_col_vecs(\@{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}}) - 
00364                 ($rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans})*(Matrix->new_from_col_vecs(\@ch_coord))) 
00365                 < $options{zeroLevelTol} ) {
00366                 $rh_ans->{score} = 1;
00367             } else {
00368                 $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00369             }
00370         } else {
00371             $rh_ans->{score}=0;
00372         }
00373     }
00374     $rh_ans;
00375     
00376 }
00377 
00378 
00379 =head2 vec_list_string
00380 
00381 This is a check_syntax type method (in fact I borrowed some of that method's code) for vector input.
00382 The student needs to enter vectors like:        [1,0,0],[1,2,3],[0,9/sqrt(10),1/sqrt(10)]
00383 Each entry can contain functions and operations and the usual math constants (pi and e).
00384 The vectors, however can not be added or multiplied or scalar multiplied by the student.
00385 Most errors are handled well. Any error in an entry is caught by the PG_answer_eval like it is in num_cmp or fun_cmp.
00386 Right now the method basically ignores every thing outside the vectors. Also, an unmatched open parenthesis is caught,
00387 but a unmatched close parenthesis ends the vector, and since everything outside is ignored, no error is sent (other than the
00388 later when the length of the vectors is checked.
00389 In the end, the method returns an array of Matrix objects.   
00390 
00391 =cut
00392 
00393 sub vec_list_string{
00394     my $rh_ans = shift;
00395     my %options = @_;
00396     my $i;
00397     my $entry = "";
00398     my $char;
00399     my @paren_stack;
00400     my $length = length($rh_ans->{student_ans});
00401     my @temp;
00402     my $j = 0;
00403     my @answers;
00404     my $paren;
00405     my $display_ans;
00406     
00407     for( $i = 0; $i < $length ; $i++ ) {
00408         $char = substr($rh_ans->{student_ans},$i,1);
00409     
00410         if( $char =~ /\(|\[|\{/ ){
00411                 push( @paren_stack, $char )
00412         }
00413         
00414         if( !( $char =~ /\(|\[|\{/ && scalar(@paren_stack) == 1 ) ) {
00415             if( $char !~ /,|\)|\]|\}/ ){
00416                 $entry .= $char;
00417             } else {
00418                 if( $char =~ /,/ || ( $char =~ /\)|\]|\}/ && scalar(@paren_stack) == 1 ) ) {
00419                     if( length($entry) == 0 ){
00420                         if( $char !~ /,/ ){
00421                             $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','There is a syntax error in your answer');
00422                         } else {
00423                                 $rh_ans->{preview_text_string}   .= ",";
00424                                 $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string}  .= ",";
00425                                 $display_ans .= ",";                
00426                         }
00427                     } else {
00428                     
00429                         # This parser code was origianally taken from PGanswermacros::check_syntax
00430                         # but parts of it needed to be slighty modified for this context
00431                         my $parser = new AlgParserWithImplicitExpand;
00432                         my $ret = $parser -> parse($entry);         #for use with loops
00433 
00434                         if ( ref($ret) )  {     ## parsed successfully
00435                             $parser -> tostring();
00436                             $parser -> normalize();
00437                             $entry = $parser -> tostring();
00438                             $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= $entry.",";
00439                             $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} .=  $parser -> tolatex().",";
00440 
00441                         } else {                    ## error in parsing
00442 
00443                             $rh_ans->{'student_ans'}            =   'syntax error:'.$display_ans. $parser->{htmlerror},
00444                             $rh_ans->{'ans_message'}            =   $display_ans.$parser -> {error_msg},
00445                             $rh_ans->{'preview_text_string'}    =   '',
00446                             $rh_ans->{'preview_latex_string'}   =   '',
00447                             $rh_ans->throw_error('SYNTAX',  'syntax error in answer:'.$display_ans.$parser->{htmlerror} . "$main::BR" .$parser -> {error_msg}.".$main::BR");
00448                         }
00449                     
00450                         my ($inVal,$PG_eval_errors,$PG_full_error_report) = PG_answer_eval($entry);
00451             
00452                         if ($PG_eval_errors) {
00453                             $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','There is a syntax error in your answer.') ;
00454                             $rh_ans->{ans_message} = clean_up_error_msg($PG_eval_errors);
00455                             last;
00456                         } else {
00457                             $entry = prfmt($inVal,$options{format});
00458                             $display_ans .= $entry.",";
00459                             push(@temp , $entry);
00460                         }
00461                         
00462                         if( $char =~ /\)|\]|\}/ && scalar(@paren_stack) == 1) { 
00463                             pop @paren_stack;
00464                             chop($rh_ans->{preview_text_string});
00465                             chop($rh_ans->{preview_latex_string});
00466                             chop($display_ans);
00467                             $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= "]";
00468                             $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} .= "]";
00469                             $display_ans .= "]";
00470                             if( scalar(@temp) > 0 ) {
00471                                 push( @answers,Matrix->new_from_col_vecs([\@temp]));
00472                                 while(scalar(@temp) > 0 ){
00473                                     pop @temp;
00474                                 }
00475                             } else {
00476                                 $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','There is a syntax error in your answer.');
00477                             }
00478                         }
00479                     }
00480                     $entry = "";        
00481                 } else {    
00482                     $paren = pop @paren_stack;
00483                     if( scalar(@paren_stack) > 0 ){
00484                         #this uses ASCII to check if the parens match up
00485                         # in ASCII ord ( = 40 , ord ) = 41 , ord [ = 91 ,
00486                         # ord ] = 93 , ord { = 123 , ord } = 125
00487                         if( (ord($char) - ord($paren) <= 2) ){
00488                             $entry = $entry . $char;
00489                         }else{
00490                             $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','There is a syntax error in your answer');
00491                         }       
00492                     }
00493                 }
00494             }
00495         } else {
00496             $rh_ans->{preview_text_string}   .= "[";
00497             $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string}  .= "[";
00498             $display_ans .= "[";
00499         }
00500     }
00501     $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} = \@answers;
00502     $rh_ans->{student_ans} = $display_ans unless $rh_ans->{error_flag};
00503     $rh_ans;
00504 }
00505 
00506 =head5 ans_array_filter
00507 
00508     This filter was created to get, format, and evaluate each entry of the ans_array and ans_array_extension
00509     answer entry methods. Running this filter is necessary to get all the entries out of the answer
00510     hash. Each entry is evaluated and the resulting number is put in the display for student answer
00511     as a string. For evaluation purposes an array of arrays of arrays is created called ra_student_ans
00512     and placed in the hash. The entries are [array_number][row_number][column_number]. The latex strings
00513     for each entry are taken from the parser and put, as a matrix, into the previewer. The preview text
00514     string is also created, but this display method becomes confusing when large matrices are used.
00515 
00516 =cut
00517 
00518 
00519 sub ans_array_filter{
00520     my $rh_ans = shift;
00521     my %options = @_;
00522 #   assign_option_aliases( \%opt,
00523 #     );
00524     set_default_options(\%options,
00525         _filter_name  =>  'ans_array_filter',             
00526     );
00527 #   $rh_ans->{ans_label} =~ /$ArRaY(\d+)\[\d+,\d+,\d+\]/;  # CHANGE made to accomodate HTML 4.01 standards for name attribute
00528     $rh_ans->{ans_label} =~ /$ArRaY(\d+)\_\_\d+\-\d+\-\d+\_\_/;
00529     my $ans_num = $1;
00530     my @keys = grep /$ArRaY$ans_num/, keys(%{$main::inputs_ref});
00531     my $key;
00532     my @array = ();
00533     my ($i,$j,$k) = (0,0,0);
00534     
00535     #the keys aren't in order, so their info has to be put into the array before doing anything with it
00536     foreach $key (@keys){
00537 #       $key =~ /ArRaY\d+\[(\d+),(\d+),(\d+)\]/;
00538 #       ($i,$j,$k) = ($1,$2,$3);
00539 #       $array[$i][$j][$k] = ${$main::inputs_ref}{'ArRaY'.$ans_num.'['.$i.','.$j.','.$k.']'};
00540         $key =~ /$ArRaY\d+\_\_(\d+)\-(\d+)\-(\d+)\_\_/;
00541         ($i,$j,$k) = ($1,$2,$3);
00542         $array[$i][$j][$k] = ${$main::inputs_ref}{"$ArRaY".$ans_num.'__'.$i.'-'.$j.'-'.$k.'__'};     
00543 
00544     }
00545     #$rh_ans->{debug_student_answer }=  \@array;
00546     my $display_ans = "";
00547         
00548     for( $i=0; $i < scalar(@array) ; $i ++ ) {
00549         $display_ans .= " [";
00550             $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= ' [';       
00551             $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} .= '\begin{pmatrix} ';
00552         for( $j = 0; $j < scalar( @{$array[$i]} ) ; $j++ ) {
00553             $display_ans .= " [";
00554                     $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= ' [';       
00555                     for( $k = 0; $k < scalar( @{$array[$i][$j]} ) ; $k ++ ){
00556                 my $entry = $array[$i][$j][$k];
00557                 $entry = math_constants($entry);
00558                 # This parser code was origianally taken from PGanswermacros::check_syntax
00559                 # but parts of it needed to be slighty modified for this context
00560                 my $parser = new AlgParserWithImplicitExpand;
00561                 my $ret = $parser -> parse($entry);         #for use with loops
00562 
00563                 if ( ref($ret) )  {     ## parsed successfully
00564                     $parser -> tostring();
00565                     $parser -> normalize();
00566                     $entry = $parser -> tostring();
00567                     $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= $entry.",";
00568                     $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} .= $parser -> tolatex() . '& ';
00569                     
00570                 } else {                    ## error in parsing
00571                     $rh_ans->{'student_ans'}            =   'syntax error:'.$display_ans. $parser->{htmlerror},
00572                     $rh_ans->{'ans_message'}            =   $display_ans.$parser -> {error_msg},
00573                     $rh_ans->{'preview_text_string'}    =   '',
00574                     $rh_ans->throw_error('SYNTAX',  'syntax error in answer:'.$display_ans.$parser->{htmlerror} . "$main::BR" .$parser -> {error_msg}.".$main::BR");
00575                 }
00576                 
00577                 my ($inVal,$PG_eval_errors,$PG_full_error_report) = PG_answer_eval($entry);
00578                 if ($PG_eval_errors) {
00579                     $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','There is a syntax error in your answer.') ;
00580                     $rh_ans->{ans_message} = clean_up_error_msg($PG_eval_errors);
00581                     last;
00582                 } else {
00583                     $entry = prfmt($inVal,$options{format});
00584                     $display_ans .= $entry.",";
00585                     $array[$i][$j][$k] = $entry;
00586                 }       
00587             }
00588             chop($rh_ans->{preview_text_string});
00589             chop($display_ans);
00590                     $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= '] ,';       
00591                    $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} .= '\\\\';     
00592             $display_ans .= '] ,';  
00593         
00594         }
00595         chop($rh_ans->{preview_text_string});
00596         chop($display_ans);
00597                 $rh_ans->{preview_text_string} .= '] ,';        
00598                 $rh_ans->{preview_latex_string} .= '\end{pmatrix}'.' , ';
00599         $display_ans .= '] ,';  
00600     }
00601     chop($rh_ans->{preview_text_string});
00602     chop($rh_ans->{preview_latex_string});
00603     chop($rh_ans->{preview_latex_string});
00604     chop($rh_ans->{preview_latex_string});
00605     chop($display_ans);
00606 
00607     my @temp = ();
00608     for( $i = 0 ; $i < scalar( @array ); $i++ ){
00609         push @temp , display_matrix($array[$i], 'left'=>'.', 'right'=>'.');
00610         push @temp , "," unless $i == scalar(@array) - 1;
00611     }
00612     $rh_ans->{student_ans} = mbox(\@temp);
00613     $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} = \@array;
00614     
00615     $rh_ans;
00616 
00617 }
00618

00620 sub are_orthogonal_vecs{
00621     my ($vec_ref , %opts) = @_;
00622     $vec_ref->{_filter_name}  = 'are_orthogonal_vecs';
00623     my @vecs = ();
00624     if( ref($vec_ref) eq 'AnswerHash' )
00625     {
00626         @vecs = @{$vec_ref->{ra_student_ans}};
00627     }else{
00628         @vecs = @{$vec_ref};
00629     }
00630      
00631     my $num = scalar(@vecs);
00632     my $length = $vecs[0]->[1];
00633     
00634     for( my $i=0; $i < $num ; $i ++ ) {
00635         for( my $j = $i+1; $j < $num ; $j++ ) {
00636             if( $vecs[$i]->scalar_product($vecs[$j]) > $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault ) {
00637                 if( ref( $vec_ref ) eq 'AnswerHash' ){
00638                     $vec_ref->{score} = 0;
00639                     if( $vec_ref->{help} =~ /orthogonal|orthonormal|verbose/ )
00640                     {
00641                         $vec_ref->throw_error('EVAL','You have entered vectors which are not orthogonal. ');
00642                     }else{
00643                         $vec_ref->throw_error('EVAL');
00644                     }
00645                     return $vec_ref;
00646                 } else {
00647                     return 0;
00648                 }               
00649             }
00650         }
00651     }
00652     if( ref( $vec_ref ) eq 'AnswerHash' ){
00653         $vec_ref->{score} = 1;
00654         $vec_ref;
00655     } else {
00656         1;
00657     }
00658 }
00659 
00660 sub is_diagonal{
00661     my $matrix  =   shift;
00662     my %options     =   @_;
00663     my $process_ans_hash = ( ref( $matrix ) eq 'AnswerHash' ) ? 1 : 0 ;
00664     my ($rh_ans);
00665     if ($process_ans_hash) {
00666         $rh_ans = $matrix;
00667         $matrix = $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans};
00668     }
00669 
00670     return 0 unless defined($matrix);
00671 
00672     if( ref($matrix) eq 'ARRAY' ) {
00673         my @matrix = @{$matrix};
00674         @matrix = @{$matrix[0]} if ref($matrix[0][0]) eq 'ARRAY';
00675         if( ref($matrix[0]) ne 'ARRAY' or scalar( @matrix ) != scalar( @{$matrix[0]} ) ){
00676             warn "It is impossible for a non-square matrix to be diagonal, if you are a student, please tell your professor that there is a problem."; 
00677         }
00678         
00679         for( my $i = 0; $i < scalar( @matrix ) ; $i++ ) {
00680             for( my $j = 0; $j < scalar( @{$matrix[0]} ); $j++ ){
00681                 if( $matrix[$i][$j] != 0 and $i != $j )
00682                 {
00683                         if ($process_ans_hash){
00684                             $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00685                             return $rh_ans;
00686                         } else {
00687                         return 0;
00688                     }                   
00689                 }               
00690             }       
00691         }
00692         if ($process_ans_hash){
00693             return $rh_ans;
00694             } else {
00695             return 1;
00696         }
00697     } elsif ( ref($matrix) eq 'Matrix' ) {
00698         if( $matrix->[1] != $matrix->[2] ) {
00699             warn "It is impossible for a non-square matrix to be diagonal, if you are a student, please tell your professor that there is a problem."; 
00700             if ($process_ans_hash){
00701                 $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00702                     return $rh_ans;
00703                 } else {
00704                 return 0;
00705             }
00706         }
00707         for( my $i = 0; $i < $matrix->[1] ; $i++ ) {
00708             for( my $j = 0; $j < $matrix->[2] ; $j++ ) {
00709                 if( $matrix->[0][$i][$j] != 0 and $i != $j ){
00710                         if ($process_ans_hash){
00711                             $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00712                         return $rh_ans;
00713                         } else {
00714                         return 0;
00715                     }
00716                 }
00717             }
00718         }
00719         if ($process_ans_hash) {
00720             return $rh_ans;
00721             } else {
00722             return 1;
00723         }
00724     } else {
00725         warn "There is a problem with the problem, please alert your professor.";
00726         if ($process_ans_hash){
00727             $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00728                 return $rh_ans;
00729             } else {
00730             return 0;
00731         }
00732     }
00733 
00734 }
00735 
00736 
00737 sub are_unit_vecs{
00738     my ( $vec_ref,%opts ) = @_;
00739     $vec_ref->{_filter_name}  = 'are_unit_vecs';
00740     my @vecs = ();
00741     if( ref($vec_ref) eq 'AnswerHash' )
00742     {
00743         @vecs = @{$vec_ref->{ra_student_ans}};
00744     }else{
00745         @vecs = @{$vec_ref};
00746     }
00747     
00748     my $i = 0;
00749     my $num = scalar(@vecs);
00750     my $length = $vecs[0]->[1];
00751         
00752     for( ; $i < $num ; $i ++ ) {
00753         if( abs(sqrt($vecs[$i]->scalar_product($vecs[$i]))- 1) > $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault )
00754         {
00755             if( ref( $vec_ref ) eq 'AnswerHash' ){
00756                 $vec_ref->{score} = 0;
00757                 if( $vec_ref->{help} =~ /unit|orthonormal|verbose/ )
00758                 {
00759                     $vec_ref->throw_error('EVAL','You have entered vector(s) which are not of unit length.');
00760                 }else{
00761                     $vec_ref->throw_error('EVAL');
00762                 }
00763                 return $vec_ref;
00764             }else{
00765                 return 0;
00766             }
00767                                 
00768         }
00769     }
00770                 
00771     if( ref( $vec_ref ) eq 'AnswerHash' ){
00772         $vec_ref->{score} = 1;
00773         $vec_ref;
00774     }else{
00775         1;
00776     }
00777 }
00778 
00779 sub display_correct_vecs{
00780     my ( $ra_vecs,%opts ) = @_;
00781     my @ra_vecs = @{$ra_vecs};
00782     my @temp = ();
00783     
00784     for( my $i = 0 ; $i < scalar(@ra_vecs) ; $i++ ) {
00785         push @temp, display_matrix(Matrix->new_from_col_vecs([$ra_vecs[$i]]),'left'=>'.','right'=>'.');
00786         push @temp, ",";
00787     }
00788     
00789     pop @temp;
00790     
00791     mbox(\@temp);
00792 
00793 }
00794 
00795 sub vec_solution_cmp{
00796     my $correctAnswer = shift;
00797     my %opt = @_;
00798 
00799     set_default_options(    \%opt,
00800                 'zeroLevelTol'          =>  $main::functZeroLevelTolDefault,
00801                 'debug'                 =>  0,
00802                 'mode'                  =>  'basis',
00803                 'help'                  =>  'none',
00804     );
00805     
00806     
00807 ## This is where the correct answer should be checked someday.
00808     my $matrix                  =   Matrix->new_from_col_vecs($correctAnswer);
00809     
00810     
00811 #construct the answer evaluator
00812     my $answer_evaluator = new AnswerEvaluator;
00813 
00814     $answer_evaluator->{debug}           = $opt{debug};
00815     $answer_evaluator->ans_hash(    
00816                     correct_ans         =>  display_correct_vecs($correctAnswer),
00817                     old_correct_ans     =>  $correctAnswer,
00818                     rm_correct_ans      =>  $matrix,
00819                     zeroLevelTol        =>  $opt{zeroLevelTol},
00820                     debug               =>  $opt{debug},
00821                     mode                =>  $opt{mode},
00822                     help                =>  $opt{help},
00823     );
00824 
00825     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(\&ans_array_filter);
00826     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(
00827         sub{
00828             my ($rh_ans,@options) = @_; 
00829             $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = "create student answer as an array of vectors";
00830             my @student_array = @{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}};
00831             my @array = ();
00832             for( my $i = 0; $i < scalar(@student_array) ; $i ++ ) {
00833                 push( @array, Matrix->new_from_array_ref($student_array[$i]));
00834             }
00835             $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} = \@array;
00836             $rh_ans;
00837         }
00838     );
00839     #ra_student_ans is now the students answer as an array of vectors
00840     # anonymous subroutine to check dimension and length of the student vectors
00841     # if either is wrong, the answer is wrong.
00842     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(
00843         sub{
00844             my $rh_ans = shift;
00845             $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = "check_dimension_and_length";
00846             my $length = $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans}->[1];
00847             my $dim = $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans}->[2];
00848             if( $dim != scalar(@{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}}))
00849             {
00850             
00851                 $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00852                 if( $rh_ans->{help} =~ /dim|verbose/ )
00853                 {
00854                     $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','You have entered the wrong number of vectors.');
00855                 }else{
00856                     $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00857                 }
00858             }
00859             for( my $i = 0; $i < scalar( @{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} }) ; $i++ ) {
00860                 if( $length != $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}->[$i]->[1]) {
00861                     $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00862                     if( $rh_ans->{help} =~ /length|verbose/ ) {
00863                         $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL','You have entered vector(s) of the wrong length.');
00864                     }else{
00865                         $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL');
00866                     }
00867                 }
00868             }
00869             $rh_ans;
00870         }
00871     );
00872     # Install prefilter for various modes
00873     if( $opt{mode} ne 'basis' )  {
00874         if( $opt{mode} =~ /orthogonal|orthonormal/ ) {
00875             $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(\&are_orthogonal_vecs);
00876         }
00877         
00878         if( $opt{mode} =~ /unit|orthonormal/ ) {
00879             $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter(\&are_unit_vecs);
00880                     
00881         }
00882     }
00883         
00884     $answer_evaluator->install_evaluator(\&compare_vec_solution, %opt);
00885     
00886     $answer_evaluator->install_post_filter(
00887         sub {my $rh_ans = shift;
00888                 if ($rh_ans->catch_error('SYNTAX') ) {
00889                     $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $rh_ans->{error_message};
00890                     $rh_ans->clear_error('SYNTAX');
00891                 }
00892                 if ($rh_ans->catch_error('EVAL') ) {
00893                     $rh_ans->{ans_message} = $rh_ans->{error_message};
00894                     $rh_ans->clear_error('EVAL');
00895                 }
00896                 $rh_ans;
00897         }
00898     );
00899     $answer_evaluator;
00900     
00901 }
00902 
00903         
00904 sub compare_vec_solution {
00905     my ( $rh_ans, %options ) = @_ ;
00906     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = "compare_vec_solution";
00907     my @space = @{$rh_ans->{ra_student_ans}};
00908     my $solution = shift @space;
00909     
00910     # A lot of the following code was taken from Matrix::proj_coeff
00911     # calling this method recursively would be a waste of time since
00912     # the prof's matrix never changes and solve_LR is an expensive
00913     # operation. This way it is only done once.
00914     my $matrix = $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans};
00915     my ($dim,$x_vector, $base_matrix);
00916     my $errors = undef;
00917     my $lin_space_tr= ~ $matrix;
00918     $matrix = $lin_space_tr * $matrix;
00919     my $matrix_lr = $matrix->decompose_LR();
00920     
00921     #this section determines whether or not the first vector, a solution to
00922     #the system, is a linear combination of the prof's vectors in which there
00923     #is a nonzero coefficient on the first term, the prof's solution to the system
00924     $solution = $lin_space_tr*$solution;
00925     ($dim,$x_vector, $base_matrix) = $matrix_lr->solve_LR($solution);
00926     #$rh_ans->{debug_compare_vec_solution} = $x_vector->element(1,1);
00927     if( $dim ){
00928         $rh_ans->throw_error('EVAL', "A unique adapted answer could not be determined.  Possibly the parameters have coefficient zero.<br>  dim = $dim base_matrix is $base_matrix\n" );  # only print if the dim is not zero.
00929         $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00930         $rh_ans;
00931     } elsif( abs($x_vector->element(1,1) -1) >= $options{zeroLevelTol} ) { 
00932         # changes by MEG 6/24/05
00933         # the student answer needs to be a linear combination of the instructors vectors
00934         # and the coefficient of the first vector needs to be 1 (it is NOT enough that it be non-zero).
00935         # if this is not the case, then the answer is wrong.
00936         # replaced   $x_vector->[0][0][0]  by $x_vector->element(1,1)  since this doesn't depend on the internal structure of the matrix object.
00937         
00938         $rh_ans->{score} = 0;
00939         $rh_ans;
00940     } else {
00941         $rh_ans->{score} = 1;
00942         my @correct_space = @{$rh_ans->{old_correct_ans}};
00943         shift @correct_space;
00944         $rh_ans->{rm_correct_ans} = Matrix->new_from_col_vecs(\@correct_space);
00945         $rh_ans->{ra_student_ans} = \@space;
00946         return compare_basis( $rh_ans, %options );
00947     }
00948 }
